challenges.title: Left at the Light
challenges.description: Another beginner reverse engineering challenge with basic obfuscation.
challenges.solution_summary: Similar to Seven Easy Pieces, this binary contains the flag but with slight encoding. Using strings and basic analysis reveals the flag.

challenges.title: A Tree of Knives
challenges.solution_summary: The binary uses simple XOR encoding. Analyzing with Ghidra shows the XOR key, allowing us to decode the flag.

challenges.title: Gremlins in the Gears
challenges.solution_summary: The binary performs ROT13 or similar character transformations. Reversing the algorithm reveals the flag.

challenges.title: Bearing the Load
challenges.solution_summary: Using ltrace or strace reveals library calls that construct the flag at runtime.

challenges.title: The Glass Bead Game
challenges.solution_summary: The binary uses base64 encoding combined with ROT13. Identifying and reversing both encodings reveals the flag.

challenges.title: Make the Pieces Sing
challenges.description: MIDI file analysis and reverse engineering.
challenges.solution_summary: The challenge validates MIDI fingerprints. Analyzing the validation logic reveals note sequences that encode the flag.

challenges.title: Mason, Meridian
challenges.solution_summary: The program has a Heartbleed-like vulnerability where we can request more bytes than the buffer size, leaking stack memory containing the flag at offset 96.
